7.19.19  12:20 am   when you combine a certain thing with another certain thing you can get an incredibly emotional moment. i take for example you songs: in i wanna be a movie star at the part "everybody wants more than just a friend" you added the phrase "let's reestructure the fabric of the known universe" in the video. the fact here is that you added it at a part when the melody has like a "rise" so it causes some kind of euphoria, mixed with adrenaline, inspiration and energy. i mean, if that sentence wouldn't be there it'd definitely have a less-powerful effect. i also noticed that in and the day goes on with the "mountain escape plan" and the "use a bike to escape the grid" at a calm part preparing for the "rising part" ("and i'm right where I belong"). but the truth is you do this a lot, countless times, do you do this on purpose?

7.18.19  8:06 pm   I had my phone audio on mono for ~6 months without knowing it by accident, and I switched it off today, allowing songs to make full use of my car's surround sound speakers. Contrary to my expectations since you are a small indie producer with little/no outside help, your songs made great use of it (particularly when i get older). Do you design music with different types of speakers that might play them in mind?
